admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
subsc: Adult literacy/non-formal education,Vocational training,Central government administration
trustfund:
TF022559-PHRD-VOCATIONAL TRAINING,TF039719-TUNISIA - SECOND TRG. AND
            EMPLOYMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, and likely sustainability, despite modest
            institutional development impacts, and unsatisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower. A number of
            lessons are summarized as follows. First addressed, is the
            need to secure private sector participation amidst major
            reforms, through specific project activities to engage the
            private sector in the governance and financing of the
            sector, which requires technical assistance, and incentives
            to promote its participation. Furthermore, in the context of
            weak implementation capacity, sequencing of reforms is
            paramount, which should be addressed in project design,
            prioritizing issues as agreed by the Government and
            stakeholders. This project design should have focused on
            major labor market needs, in this case, agriculture,
            commerce, and trade skills. The apparent lack of government
            commitment weakened project outcomes; instead, ensuring
            commitment to strengthen financial management, to
            counterpart funding, and to play a substantial role in
            ensuring private sector involvement, would have resulted in
            satisfactory outcomes. This would have fostered relevant
            cofinancing, efficient vocational training financing, and
            realistic goals for institutional reforms.
